name: Port Hyl
role_in_state: primary transshipment port and shipbuilding center
culture_adjustments: more cosmopolitan Coastal Tongues mixing from visiting crews
tighter guild control over apprenticeship and civic offices
sea-ritual practices intensify everyday law and contracts
kinship defined by ship-households rather than inland clans
dispute resolution skews toward negotiated charter agreements
risks: dockfire from drying and salting works
constraints: limited agricultural hinterland â€” relies on imports
ritual magic dependent on scarce imported reagents
harbor silting requires continual dredging under guild control
notes: state's main transshipment hub and seat of the chief shipwright guild
annual augury season centralizes navigational rites and market activity
long-range mind-influence outlawed; auguries supplemental to seamanship
